virtuals.metaDescription: Sketch can now export inside or outside borders in your design into centered SVG strokes. No other vector design software does this—it saves you tons of time and makes your SVG graphics more reliable.
virtuals.subtitle: Sketch just released version 43, and there’s one improvement that is so noteworthy I need shout from the rooftops with joy.

bc8fc5f6d5b1.title: Sketch’s Brilliant New Way to Export Borders as SVG

content.metaDescription: Sketch can now export inside or outside borders in your design into centered SVG strokes. No other vector design software does this—it saves you tons of time and makes your SVG graphics more reliable.
content.subtitle: Sketch just released version 43, and there’s one improvement that is so noteworthy I need shout from the rooftops with joy.

content.subtitle: There are numerous places in the article that sound like they could be referring to the SVG elements, but where I’ve used the word “border…

paragraphs.text: You’re totally right that the distinction between border and stroke can be important. In general, I try to use “border” only when talking about a layer while it is still in Sketch, and “stroke” when talking about the resulting SVG.

1d3c0e7494d6.title: another same article to sell me something…

paragraphs.name: 0ff2
paragraphs.text: another same article to sell me something…

Great article..I have to tell you that in 20 years of print production clients still can’t understand vector vs bitmap. They either fear AI or my favorite rasterize a vector art and ask for 60ft mural…”Why I’m seeing pixels?..”…I’m getting ready for s career switch from print to code and UI. SketchApp is on top of my list. Looking forward to SVGO article

paragraphs.name: 4c3b
paragraphs.text: Nice article! It might seem like a nitpicky thing, but you keep referring to them as borders- only divs have borders, SVGs have strokes. I make the distinction because, as you show- borders and strokes have different specs and interchanging the terms is potentially confusing to people. Glad sketch is stepping up their SVG export game a bit!

8aed101dec32.title: I’ve always chose to outline strokes but I can definitely see the benefit of sketch’s ability to…

paragraphs.name: c251
paragraphs.text: I’ve always chose to outline strokes but I can definitely see the benefit of sketch’s ability to reorient the path whenever you’re using outer/inner strokes. The masking approach that I’ve seen is very annoying because it alters the structure of the SVG in such a way where it makes it more difficult (if not impossible) to manipulate the SVG in code…

paragraphs.name: de27
paragraphs.text: Great article. For anyone new to webdesign and wanting a quick and easy way to create a modern website, try out Panther

paragraphs.name: 04ee
paragraphs.text: Great post Peter. I have facing issues on the antialiasing artifacts when exporting svg to After Effect to animate some icons. This tip will help me, thanks a lot!
